sentence: In a separate suit, Free Speech for People (FSFP), an organization formed in 2010, committed to getting money out of politics and securing and protecting the right of all citizens to vote – a right guaranteed by the 14th amendment – filed suit in Maricopa County against US Representatives Paul Gosar (R-AZ), Andy Biggs (R-AZ), and former GOP state Rep. Mark Finchem to prevent each of them from running for re-election.

sentence: Representatives Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs and state Representative Mark Finchem, a Republican from Oro Valley, claim they violated section three of the 14th Amendment, which states no governmental official “shall have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the same, or given aid or comfort to the enemies thereof.” Attorneys for the lawmakers argued before Maricopa County Superior Court Judge Christopher Coury on Wednesday.

sentence: On Friday, however, an Arizona judge ruled against one of the latest rounds of lawsuits, this time from voting groups seeking to prevent Reps.
